perturbation.original_text:
3.4 ACCEPTANCE OF MILESTONE DELIVERABLEÍ¾ CHANGE REQUESTS
Client will notify Developer in writing of any failure of a Milestone Deliverable to comply with the Specifications, or of any other objections,
corrections, changes or amendments required (a Change Request), within ten (10) days of such Milestone's Acceptance Test Date. Any Change
Request shall be sufficient to identify, with clarity, any objection, correction, change or amendment to such Milestone Deliverable. In the absence
of a Change Request from Client within the time periods detailed herein, the Milestone Deliverable will be deemed accepted by Client.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.4 ACCEPTANCE OF MILESTONE DELIVERABLE
Client will notify Developer in writing of any failure of a Milestone Deliverable to comply with the Specifications, or of any other objections,
corrections, changes or amendments required, within ten (10) days of such Milestone's Acceptance Test Date. In the absence
of a specific notification from Client within the time periods detailed herein, the Milestone Deliverable will be deemed accepted by Client.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit definition of 'Change Request,' the modified text creates ambiguity. While the contract still mentions the need for the client to communicate issues, it doesn't define how a formal 'Change Request' should look. This weakens the enforcement since the developer can argue that a vague email, for example, doesn't constitute a formal rejection and therefore the deliverable is accepted. This creates a contradiction as later sections assume a formal Change Request process, which is not clearly defined here.

perturbation.original_text:
5. Payment
5.1 FEES AND EXPENSES
Client will pay fees to Developer for Project Services and Deliverables as Described in the SOW (the Fees). Developer will pay its own expenses for
the Project (collectively, the Expenses) unless stated otherwise in the SOW.
5.2 FEES AND EXPENSES
All Fees shall be due pursuant to the Fee payment schedule provided in a SOW hereto (the Fee Payment Schedule). Client's failure to remit payment
to Developer for Fees due and owning will constitute a material breach of this Agreement.
5.3 BONUS
If Developer completes the Services, and delivers the Deliverables, as reasonably accepted by Client, upon a date prior to the Final Delivery Date as
specific in a SOW hereto, Client will pay Developer a bonus Fee in the amount detailed in the applicable SOW (the Bonus).
5.4 PAYMENT
Client shall pay Fees, Expenses (if any), and any Bonus to Developer via w re to Developer's bank account at:
Chase Bank
1955 156th Avenue NE Bellevue, Washington 98007
425-590-4010
Routing: 325070760
Account :676313880
perturbation.changed_text:
5. Payment
5.1 FEES AND EXPENSES
Client will pay fees to Developer for Project Services and Deliverables as Described in the SOW (the Fees). Developer will pay its own expenses for
the Project (collectively, the Expenses) unless stated otherwise in the SOW.
5.2 FEES AND EXPENSES
Client's failure to remit payment
to Developer for Fees due and owning will constitute a material breach of this Agreement.
5.3 BONUS
If Developer completes the Services, and delivers the Deliverables, as reasonably accepted by Client, upon a date prior to the Final Delivery Date as
specific in a SOW hereto, Client will pay Developer a bonus Fee in the amount detailed in the applicable SOW (the Bonus).
5.4 PAYMENT
Client shall pay Fees, Expenses (if any), and any Bonus to Developer via wire to Developer's bank account.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the Developer's bank account details, Section 5.4 becomes unenforceable. While the section states that the client will pay via wire, the lack of specific banking information makes the process impossible to complete. This omission creates a contradiction as the contract dictates a mode of payment without providing the necessary instructions for said payment, which would result in breach of contract as Section 5.2 suggests any failure to pay due amounts will be a material breach.

perturbation.original_text:
10.3 NON DISPARAGEMENT CLAUSE
The Client and the Designer both agree to never to disparage or speak ill of the other party to anyone and or post negative or disparaging
comments Online regarding any of the Designer's products, services, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, employees or shareholders, and will
take reasonable steps to prevent and will not knowingly permit any of their respective employees or agents to, disparage or speak ill of such
persons. For purposes of this Section, "disparage" shall mean any negative statement whether written or oral, about Seattle Software Developers,
Inc., Dot Com LLC. and or any of its affiliates.
The Client and Designer both agree not to post on defamatory websites or review websites any negative posts concerning each other, the names of
our companies, and our employees. Both the Client and the Designer both agree and acknowledge that this non-disparagement provision is a
material term of this Agreement, the absence of which would have resulted in the Company refusing to enter into this Agreement.
Subject to the terms, conditions, express representations and warranties provided in this Agreement, Designer and Client both agree to indemnify,
save and hold armless each other from any and all damages, liabilities, costs, losses or expenses arising out of any finding of fact which is
inconsistent with Designer's representations and warranties made herein, except in the event any such claims, damages, liabilities, costs, losses or
expenses arise directly as a result of gross negligence or misconduct of Client.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.3 NON DISPARAGEMENT CLAUSE
The Client and the Designer both agree to never to disparage or speak ill of the other party to anyone and or post negative or disparaging
comments Online regarding any of the Designer's products, services, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, employees or shareholders, and will
take reasonable steps to prevent and will not knowingly permit any of their respective employees or agents to, disparage or speak ill of such
persons.
The Client and Designer both agree not to post on defamatory websites or review websites any negative posts concerning each other, the names of
our companies, and our employees. Both the Client and the Designer both agree and acknowledge that this non-disparagement provision is a
material term of this Agreement, the absence of which would have resulted in the Company refusing to enter into this Agreement.
Subject to the terms, conditions, express representations and warranties provided in this Agreement, Designer and Client both agree to indemnify,
save and hold armless each other from any and all damages, liabilities, costs, losses or expenses arising out of any finding of fact which is
inconsistent with Designer's representations and warranties made herein, except in the event any such claims, damages, liabilities, costs, losses or
expenses arise directly as a result of gross negligence or misconduct of Client.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit definition of 'disparage,' the clause becomes open to interpretation. The section initially clarified what constituted disparagement (any negative statement about specific entities). Without this definition, the clause is weakened. The contract still relies on that definition in its entirety for determining if there's been any violations of the non-disparagement clause. This presents a conflict because of its absence, and any interpretation of disparagement might become highly subjective, creating uncertainty in enforcing this provision.
